pullRequest.body:
This refactors and extends the definition of `height`. Notable changes:

 * Everything put into `namespace Order`
 * Type of `krullDim` changed from `WithBot (WithTop Nat)` to `WithBot ENat`.
 * Type of `height` changed from `WithBot (WithTop Nat)` to `ENat`.
 * Definition of `height` via `LTSeries` rather than krullDim

From the Carleson project.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

This PR is a trimmed version of #15524 to include just those steps needed to recreate
the existing API; see #15524 where some of the things are going.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</details>

</details>

> This definition of `height` would be usable to define graded orders later down the line, right?

Yes and no: It would work only for `ℕ`-graded orders, not `ℤ`-graded ones. Also note that graded orders already exist.

Not ∃ in the trimmed PR.
```suggestion
theorems between `height` and `coheight`.
```

```suggestion
For `a : α`, its height (in `ℕ∞`) is defined to be `sup {n | a₀ < a₁ < ... < aₙ = a}` while its
```

```suggestion
* The Krull dimension is the same as that of the dual order (`krullDim_orderDual`).
```
sounds more correct, no?

```suggestion
lemma length_le_height_of_last_le (x : α) (p : LTSeries α) (hlast : p.last ≤ x) :
```
or maybe even
```suggestion
lemma length_le_height (x : α) (p : LTSeries α) (hlast : p.last ≤ x) :
```
since that seems pretty unambiguous to me

```suggestion
  le_height_of_last_le _ p le_rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma height_mono : Monotone (α := α) height := by
  your_proof

@[gcongr] protected lemma _root_.GCongr.height_le_height (hab : a ≤ b) : height a ≤ height b := height_mono hab
```

If you define `height` as
```suggestion
  ⨆ (p : LTSeries α) (_ : p.last ≤ a), p.length
```
...

Right, I considered this. I think I stuck to this definition as it is closer to the prose description. And on one side of `≤` one is more useful, and on the other side the other one.

Still worth changing?
Whatever definition you choose, you can have the other one as a theorem. Best of both worlds!

The definition with `p.last ≤ a` just seems more right to me to the extent that the corresponding picture is a increasing path below `a` (namely between `⊥` and `a`) rather than an increasing path ending right on `a` (but not necessarily starting at `⊥`).

As Violeta says, you can still have theorems that pretend that your current definition is still the definition
Ok, will change back to that then.

...then this is just
```suggestion
lemma height_mono : Monotone (α := α) height := fun a b hab ↦ biSup_mono hab.trans'
```

Can we also have (not necessarily in this PR)
* `krullDim α = ⨆ a : α, coheight a`
* `krullDim α = ⨆ a : α, height a + coheight a`

The first should be in the full PR (but I'll check).

The second is nice, will add there
Yes, the first one already is in #15524 (all lemmas have their coheight dual), and I added the second one.
Why is the type ascription suddenly necessary?

Previously, `height` was in `WithBot ℕ∞`; now it is in `ℕ∞`. If we don’t coerce inside the `iSup`, then the statement isn’t true for empty α.

The version with coercion outside and the `Nonempty` requirement is in the full PR.

I guess that means I should remove the comment from this PR, and introduce it in the PR that adds `krullDim_eq_iSup_height_of_nonempty`.

Oh I see, is it elaborated `↑(⨆ a, height a)` without the coercion inside? That seems like an elaboration issue we should fix. You can also hint at this being what's happening by doing
```suggestion
lemma krullDim_eq_iSup_height : krullDim α = ⨆ (a : α), ↑(height a) := by
```

```suggestion
lemma krullDim_eq_iSup_length [Nonempty α] :
```
Can you write this down in some other more rewritable way without changing the def-eq?
Sorry, I don't understand what you mean by “rewritable”?
I think that was exactly the same comment as https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16480/files#r1744927384. Resolving for the same reason
Can you rewrite this as `refine` and then `simp`?
I am pretty sure that that that's possible. Do you want me to change that?

I would strongly suggest you define `coheight` correctly (as `Inf p : LtSeries >, a <= p.last, p.length`), so that people unfolding the definition don't see the type abuse. You can/should then show `height (toDual a) = coheight a`, `height (ofDual a) = coheight a`, same thing with `height` and `coheight` reversed, and all these lemmas should be defeq

I think I tried that. I’d say the correct definition is `Inf p : LtSeries >, a <= p.head, p.length`, (head, not tail) and that’s *not* defeq to the height of the dual (you have to reverse the `p`).

Anyways, in the interest of keeping the PRs small and manageable for reviewing, shall we leave the coheight discussion to a separate PR that’s just about `coheight`? It’s not horrible if `def coheight` changes again a few days later, I think. If you are curious, see #15524 for where this is going.
I would expect the `coheight` API to come here, just after the `height` one

The coheight API is in a separate PR. Wouldn’t it be easier to review all PRs about `height` API first (so they are smaller and there is less noise), and then one PR that does the busy work of adding the coheight variant to each lemma?
Ah yeah sure. I guess I'm just a bit confused as to why you are also changing the definition of `height` but not providing its API
Fair point. I guess because the old definition is even more strange, as it has the “wrong” type, so it’s still a step in the right direction.

```suggestion
lemma height_le :
```
since it's an iff and obviously so

```suggestion
```

Hmm, if you don't have this as an intro lemma, what should become of
```lean
~/build/lean/mathlib4 $ git grep apply\ height_le
Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean:  apply height_le
Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean:  apply height_le_height_of_strictmono (α := αᵒᵈ)
Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean:  · apply height_le
Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean:  · apply height_le
Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean:  · apply height_le
Mathlib/Order/KrullDimension.lean:  · apply height_le
```
Should these now all be `apply height_le.mpr` (more plausible if the arguments are implicit, I guess)?
Yes, `height_le.mpr`. That's the point of making arguments to iff implicit (else you would need roughly three times as many lemmas! The iff, the mp, the mpr...)

I would say
```suggestion
lemma length_le_height (hlast : p.last ≤ x) :
```
Looks like I have to bind them, else `p.last` doesn’t work. And I have a mild preference mentioning the parameters, so I made them implicit.
Oh yeah, I assumed there was some `variable {p : LTSeries α} {x : α}` higher up already
Is that a requested change or is not using `variable` here within the accepted style variation for mathlib files?

Even here I would make `p` implicit. It can be figured out from either side of the inequality
```suggestion
lemma length_le_height_last : p.length ≤ height p.last :=
```
Looks like I am using this fairly often in a forward-reasoning style, e.g. with `have`. But I can use `(p := …)` then, so all good.

Deutsch wäre hier besser, aber
```suggestion
The Krull dimension is the supremum of the elements' heights.
```

While you are at it,
```suggestion
noncomputable def topologicalKrullDim (T : Type*) [TopologicalSpace T] : WithBot ℕ∞ :=
```

This is really just nitpicking but I would expect the section doc to come *outside* of the `section`, just like the module doc is before any `variable`, `open`, or `noncomputable section`
```suggestion
/-! Height -/

section height

variable {α β : Type*} [Preorder α] [Preorder β]
```

nodes.body: This definition of `height` would be usable to define graded orders later down the line, right?

> This definition of `height` would be usable to define graded orders later down the line, right?

Yes and no: It would work only for `ℕ`-graded orders, not `ℤ`-graded ones. Also note that graded orders already exist.

Thanks for this PR!
